`sumToN` Verification: The Code
-------------------------------

This file contains the deployed bytecode to be verified. The code to construct this file can be fetched in any of these two ways:
1. After running the corresponding `kontrol build ...` and `kontrol prove ...` commands, you can do `kontrol show GausSpec.check_equivalence --node 1 --expand-configuration` and fetch the bytecode from the configuration. You can replace the Right Hand Side of the arrow `=>` with it.
2. After running `forge build` go to the `out/GaussSpec.sol/GaussSpec.json` file and fetch the code in the `deployedBytecode` field. To add it to the RHS of the rule below you must feed it to the `#parseByteStack` function as shown.

There are some lemmas at the end of this module that are needed to prove the invariant in [invariant.md](invariant.md).

```k
module GAUSS-SPEC-CODE
    imports EVM

  syntax Bytes ::= "#binRuntime" [function]

  rule #binRuntime => #parseByteStack( ""  )

rule #sizeWordStack(WS           , N) => #sizeWordStack(WS, 0) +Int N requires N =/=Int 0                [simplification]
rule #sizeWordStack(WS [ I := _ ], N) => #sizeWordStack(WS, N)        requires I <Int #sizeWordStack(WS) [simplification]
rule 0 <=Int #sizeWordStack(_ , 0)    => true                                                            [simplification]
rule #sizeWordStack(_ , 0) <Int N     => false                        requires N <=Int 0                 [simplification]

endmodule
```
